cons:
Worked to death
Often short staffed
"Work life balance" really means work should be your life.
No time to pursue education or other opportunites even though they provide them, they dont support your efforts.
Dont think upper managers have any clue what happens in department. Very disconnected from employees. 
Review process is being told every year what you failed to do. 
No real opportunities for growth.

review_title: Providence has changed a great deal over the years, and not for the better.......
pros:
Great co-workers
Mission Statement
Fairly easy to get time off when needed
Family atmosphere
cons:
Pay not competitive with other health systems
Way too many managers
Benefit package not nearly as good as before
Health insurance coverage expensive.  Employee share of cost has increased the past 2 years.
Huge turnover in lower management

review_title: They no longer appreciate loyal long term nursing staff
pros: There is a retirement match
cons:
They cater to young, inexperienced & "cheap nurses...a nurse is a nurse is a nurse."
I have years of experience &have worked there for 29 plus years. I find them very insulting...

review_title: A lot of change happening, but overall a positive place to work
pros: The organization tries to maintain focus on their mission and vision. In order to do that there are a lot of changes going on throughout the organization to decrease cost savings. Most changes are handled with compassion and care. Leadership cares about their staff and the people of Providence.
cons: There are many changes which makes it the work environment a bit stressful, but nothing unmanageable. There is no bottoms up management performance review from employees for their leadership.

review_title: A large and growing organization, trying to meet the demands of its community.
pros: Enjoyed the daily patient interaction and the associated challenges it presented.  The staff was always willing to give the best care possible to each patient, and the community at large.
cons: As employees, we saw the costs of benefits rise as the benefits provided declined.

pros: Knowledgeable, skilled staff who are great to work with. Great compensation plan and benefits. The morals and company plan are very positive and rewarding.
cons: The hospital is big and sprawling with both a new and old section. It's very easy to get lost.  Management is not very understanding when it comes to family emergencies. They are extremely rigid and don't give second chances.

pros: Their culture, values and mission are a part of everyday working life at Providence.  I felt proud to be involved with such an organization.  There were many opportunities for advancement and employees were rewarded for high performance.
cons: The Epic implementation timeline was aggressive and most anyone involved in the Epic project worked over 40 hours consistently, at least during the implementation phase.

pros: strongly held belief in helping people & co-workers are proud of Providence as an organization
cons: reactive management, need stronger processes and consistency - management doesn't have a prioritized and consistent focus on long term objectives - just get it done is the message

pros: Staff on most floors I floated to are friendly and helpful. 80% of the time I have had an easy assignment bc I'm a floater. Everyone jumps in and help. Professional. They're aiming for magnet status. Up to date technology.
cons: Not always clear or given an orientation when I'm new to a floor. At times they're over compliance / have more than our state law's legal ratio! No Union - at will.

review_title: Losing sight of mission in favor of profit
pros: Can have decent wages for those that have been long term employees. Some departments offer flexible schedules. Organization wants to retain staff as a goal, although hourly workers can be treated very poorly in certain departments.
cons: Rampant nepotism, dysfunctional leadership is allowed to continue in their positions of power even though they abuse it.

review_title: Great organization with many opportunities to contribute to the health and well-being of the communities we serve
job_title: Senior Project Manager in Irvine, CA
pros: Faith based organization that is committed to values of excellence, service, dignity and justice. Excellent corporate culture. Numerous opportunities to grow professionally and personally. Employee Wellness program that provides financial incentives and support  for healthy lifestyle. They walk the walk!
cons: Large organization and growing with recent providence merger. Change is the norm so successful team members need to be flexible and open minded. Salaries vary across the organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coto De Caza, CA
pros: Compelling vision, growth oriented and financial stability. Stated goal of becoming a population health company.  Diversified portfolio in various geographic markets and product lines, including emphasis on innovation. Open collaborative culture among the majority.
cons: Conflicting goals and behavior between regional management -- acute care hospital-centric versus population health focused. Male dominated culture in leadership positions with strong showing of favoritism in promotions.

job_title: Informatics Senior Specialist in Seattle, WA
pros: There are definitely amazing individuals and specific departments to work for, the healthcare benefits are good, they have some minimal tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules.
cons: The informatics arm has lost leadership and vision, the past couple years the reputation of the area has gone down, along with inspiration and energy.  Work is increasingly difficult with shrinking resources and any kind of innovation is stifled.  Definitely not a place to go for modern, exciting workplaces in informatics; it will stall out your career.

review_title: Hoped to work at St. Joseph Health System for many years
pros: Many of the employees are great team players, supportive and knowledgeable. The values that employees are expected to uphold encourage strong faith and charity.
cons: Management encourages and then does the opposite of what they expect from employees.  They promise new initiatives and programs to encourage growth and then they make hasty cuts.

review_title: Great Mission, with tons of Opportunity!
pros: Company culture is warm and caring. There is always a focus on improving the world around us. The Mission is very important throughout the organization and there are always reminder of the importance of the Mission. Excellent benefits! Providence is a large organization with a great deal of internal mobility.
cons: Providence is a very large organization so it can be slow to implement changes (not as nimble as a smaller company).

pros: Good pay rate, decent benefits, paid time off, good team work in lab departments
cons: Too large of a company, losing touch with patients and employees. Upper administration is no longer local, cannot talk to Human Resources or benefit specialists in person.

pros: Love the mission and the passion
cons: Toxic work place. Favoritism, micromanagement.  Unprofessional. Cursing, sexual jokes, gossip. Turnover.  Not much opportunity for growth and advancement.

review_title: Experience depends on individual hospital and management team.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Portland, OR
pros: Good pay and benefits as well as staff education opportunities.
cons: Inconsistent scheduling especially for night shift employees. Strong staff hierarchy as well as lack of desire to do functions outside of perceived "rank."

pros: Great mission! Good benefits, people are great. With exceptions.
cons: They allow people with 0 talent become leaders in the small hospitals. Compassion and empathy are key in healthcare and leadership ( except for nursing) lack both. Employees are items that can be discarded, Physician's don't receive respect, managers are brought from all parts of the region affecting rapport with employees.

job_title: Home Health Physical Therapist in Spring Hill, TN
pros: The pros of home health physical therapy are meeting patients with various backgrounds, personalities, and diagnoses within the comfort of their own homes.
cons: Computer charting is essential for the healthcare field, especially for the home health field staff.  The cons of home health physical therapy was the lengthy and detailed computer charting system.

pros: Great hours, friendly and helpful staff. I feel like I'm part of a team there. Reflections/ prayers before meetingd, which sets the tone.
cons: After hiring and before your first day of work, there are a lot of tasks to finish before your first day, which is a bit anxiety provoken, but it's manageable .

pros: Large organization with lots of resources to tap into, learning opportunities, and feel-good contributions.  It's rewarding to be a part of a company that has such an influential role in the future of healthcare.
cons: There is a big cultural divide between Providence and its affiliates. Sometimes the politics get in the way of making the best decisions.

review_title: My experience as a Providence Nurse
job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Spokane, WA
pros: Providence is a known and respected health care organization. They offer competative wages and benefits. I was gifted a scholorship to obtain my BSN for nearly no cost to me. What expenses I did have, I had tuition assistance to help with.
cons: The Providence I work for has a Union. Where I am pro union, it does leave a wall between management and staff

job_title: Chaplain Resident in Los Angeles, CA
pros: This is a very large Hospital System yet it is working hard to keep its values and mission integrated in the daily work. As a one year resident chaplain I loved working for Providence St. Josephs the team of chaplain with whom I worked were committed and caring people. I hope to work in the Providence system again.
cons: Going through restructuring has been a challenge for employees.

pros: I'm a people person, as a PCT I enjoy caring and seeing people recover. I also work in the lab where I'm not doing patient care directly but I'm still a member of the team
cons: I don't enjoy working at night. I have a rough time sleeping during the day.

review_title: Good hospital, horrible HR and management
pros: The emergency department has many talented doctors, nurses, and other staff members. Patients receive quality care while there. Pay is competitive and the nursing union is very supportive and beneficial.
cons: However, the ER management and the human resources department are very unsupportive of the nursing staff. They are constantly understaffing the nurses causing dangerous risks to patients and staff. This has caused much frustration and led to high nursing turnover rates.

pros:
Some managers are great, others not so much. Some people have the opportunity to grow, others don't. 

Benefits are great. start accruing PTO (personal time off) from your first day, BUT you don't get holidays or sick days.  retirement is only 3% match. 

If you're hourly, you're never allowed to work from home.
cons: A lot of downsizing due to the Healthcare industry.  Things move at a snail pace or rushing to fix a problem.

review_title: Providence is a great place to work.
pros: Mission oriented. Respect for work life balance. Many long time employees.  Fair to staff in comp and  benefits.
cons: Lack of common standards across regions, especially accountability toward cost. Disruptive personalities are tolerated way too long, especially in mid management.

review_title: Good place, great mission, pay and advancement possibilities lacking
pros: The mission is wonderful and most employees are committed to it. The other employees are friendly and generally easy to work with
cons: Pay is below average and unless you want to change job functions, you are stuck with very small raises per year. This leads to some high turnover.

review_title: Commitment to the mission: serving the poor and vulnerable.
job_title: Chief Medical Officer in Everett, WA
pros:
Deep commitment across Providence to the mission.
Holds firmly to role of service to communities without discrimination.
Partners with physicians to drive safety, service, quality, and compassion.
cons: Rapid growth is a challenge, but strong guidance from Sisters of Providence and sponsors. Sometimes hard to drive necessary change in an organization this large.

review_title: Growing innovative health system, but old politics perservere
pros: Working with system leadership in an exciting time, growing while doing innovative things.  Leaders focus on innovation is palpable across the company.
cons: Fragmented corporate cultures, some of which are determined to preserve the status-quo

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Renton, WA
pros: The culture is very positive and the mission and values are reflected prominently within the people I work with and the leaders in the organization
cons: Providence is growing quickly with the number of recent acquisitions and affiliations. As is to be expected during this process along with the process of centralizing shared services, and systems, growing pains are evident.

pros: Decent benefits (low-cost vision and dental coverage as well,  free Trimet/MAX for full duration of employment if you work in Portland, OR); many opportunities for growth; middle-of-the-road pay and PTO; great care teams that are driven toward quality patient care; free parking; little to no micro-managing.
cons: Can have some staffing issues that limit use of vacation.

review_title: Feeding patients dressing vitals signs recording weight loss ambulation
pros: I like working in the hospital because I got more experience and I got to know  different patients. Like some one with dementia Alzheimer's elderly disabled people and many others
cons: The challenge I got is the patient was agitated and I tried calm the patient so after I redirected her to some thing else amazing.

job_title: Digital Product Manager in Seattle, WA
pros:
People very nice and everyone inspired by mission of the company
Leadership focused on digital innovation so dollars flow there.
cons:
Too many ex-employees from Amazon came to Digital Innovation and changed culture for the worse.  
Providence leadership overall is not strong - too much competition for small amount of resources.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Great staff.  Very talented staff.  Most surgeons treat staff well.  Free parking.  Discount at cafeteria.  State-of-the-art equipment.  Facility only 2 years old
cons: Extremely poor management, poor pay and extremely overworked.  Large corporation that doesn’t pay employees what they are worth, so they don’t mind the constant turnover.  Really sad

review_title: Coordinate infusion referrals, insurance verification, financial disclosure.
job_title: Home Infusion Access Coordinator in Portland, OR
pros: Really good benefits. Culture is inclusive. Lots of job opportunity.
cons: High expectancy for moderate pay. Lots of management changes in the 4 years worked. Inflexibility in schedule.

review_title: Was five star, now just three.
pros: Many departments provide a flexible schedule and telecommuting. Good people. A free Tri Met transit pass is provided every year.  Good core values.
cons: Ever reducing benefits.  Limited ability to grow unless you are willing to sacrifice work/life balance, then it's a gamble.  The growth of the organization appears to be affecting the adherence to the core values.

pros: The ministry really helps  their employees and patients. Continuing education and benefits are wonderful. I would recommend this company to all of my friends.
cons: Many departments are shorthanded and have people having to work overtime or have floats fill in instead of hiring more people

job_title: Unit Clerk/Monitor Technician in Apple Valley, CA
pros: The staff I work with are extremely educated and very helpful. We work great as a team. In a ver stressful environment, we get the job done!
cons: We don't have up to date equipment, and things always seem to break. I think you should take equipment that are used daily, and have things trouble shooted.

review_title: Providence offers full time work with many benefits.
pros: The pay really makes it worth it. They have great healthcare plans and a comfortable working environment. They offer paid time off and help pay for your school too.
cons: One challenge here would be the lack if communication.  Not all departments want to be team players and it can create problems and even a little hostility between us.

job_title: Staff RN in Mount Angel, OR
pros: Some had working staff and the residents
cons: The pay, the fact that they are not able to keep staff and so staff run the place (call in sick often, walk off the job, refuse to work on specific units) and do not get fired.

review_title: Good intentions and mission..but corporate like the rest
pros: Staff is supportive, skilled, and take care of one another.  Just pick a unit that does not have a villian for manager--might be hard
cons: Many changes---Managers and Directors selected by who you know, not by skills and experience.  One in place, not mentored meaning the front line staff deal with the fallout.  Upper administration--totally ingrown, incestuous!  Worthless.

pros: Has always felt like a family, ideas are important to leadership
cons: Lately leadership has changed and now they are not visible, decisions are not communicated to staff until after they are done, losing family feeling and becoming more corporate.

job_title: Cardiac Nurse in Long Beach, CA
pros:
Started my nursing career at St. Marys, I honestly loved every minute of it.
Very caring, hard working, friendly nursing staff
Flexible schedule 
Co workers helpful, like family
Teaching hospital, excellent medical staff
Administration very supportive of nursing staff
cons: Many shifts we were under staffed, nursing draws all their own labs, ekgs, bedside care, etc., sometimes we we lucky enough to have CNA'S work with us.

review_title: Constantly growing w/o supporting existing org
pros:
* Pay is good, but uneven throughout team
* HDHP of $1400 for individuals is lower than some other places
cons:
* Too focused on growth
* Does not plan for support of new, larger organization
* Poor communication from leadership
* Overworked, under-appreciated staff
* Token statements of support, no real action
* Half-baked projects
* No focus
* No training

pros: Great coworkers and a commitment to totally caring for patients and their needs. My manager is always responsive and committed to my growth.
cons: Change is slow to happen because it is such a large and growing organization. Unflexible in some work/life balance issues such as flexible scheduling.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Monica, CA
pros: There are several long term employees there on both day shift and night shift. The location of the hospital is nice. The anesthesiologists are amazing. Many of the doctors are very fun to work with.
cons: Management style very divisive and undermining, frequently understaffed, poor infrastructure, physicians allowed to bully nurses, friction with union/hospital...very negative work environment.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Everett, WA
pros:
-Nurses on 5A and CNAs work as team, which helps a lot with the many high acuity patients
-Designated Education Unit so if you plan on going to Nursing school, the Nurses are always willing to teach you things to get get a leg up once you get in
- Supervisors are great
cons:
-Staff matrix sometimes doesn't take into account patient acuity which makes for tough shifts with heavy patient loads
- No pay increase as a per diem CNA (at least for me)

job_title: Lab Technician in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: people are friendly, benefits are good, my immediate supervisor is great
cons: co-workers consistantly coming in late everyday, upper management and hospital administration devaluing my department by not providing the best technology to do my job, co-workers who are burned out ("retired on the job") and don't care about the patients they're serving or the impact their job has on those patient's care.

review_title: Refreshing to work in a place where people walk the talk
pros: i'm grateful every day to be able to come in to work and live our mission. We serve every person we meet with our core values  - patients, customers and other employees.  This is a refreshing change from previous fortune 100 employers.
cons: it's a non-profit ... resources always seem to be stretched way too thin. It can also take a lot of time and consensus building to get complex tasks completed.  running a business by committee is tough.

pros: Overall, decent benefits that are included with the job. Like that PTO is accumulated even while during probationary period.
cons: The fact that we have to use PTO for holidays such as Christmas, Thanksgiving, etc., is a bit unorthodox. All other places I have worked have offered those days as a paid company holiday.

pros:
Good support from management, good coworkers. Good ethics starting from the top down. Good place to work, I'd recommend it. 
Good pay. Vacation time almost always approved. Lenient sick call culture, no judgement.
cons: Equipment needs an upgrade, but this is home health wide, not just PH&S. Epic is only ok, again industry wide. Have to use vacation time for holiday pay. Vacation time accrual not that great.

job_title: Associate Patient Access Representative in Lubbock, TX
pros: My supervisor was very understanding and helpful in working with my college schedule. I enjoyed my coworkers and the work environment. I was allowed, within reason, to observe doctors and nurses in order to expand my medical knowledge for my future career.
cons: The clinic was generally busy. Sometimes we would be understaffed and have to fire on all cylinders for busy shifts. New hires were frequent, leading to needing to train and help them during already busy shifts.

pros: My coworkers are the best!! My manager works just as hard as I do and is very understanding. My floor is very flexible about time off and schedules.
cons: The patients can be extremely difficult to deal with!!! Sometimes I feel overwhelmed with my workload. My vacation time is used when I call in sick!!!! Totally ridiculous!!

pros: Excellent Clinical care, many of the clinical and business folks are very capable. Nursing and Physicians are good to work with for the most part.
cons: Lack of inclusive thought and very superficial demonstration of values, (leadership feels they are above the values in actions)

review_title: Mission-driven health system striving to deliver compassionate care while keeping up in a rapidly changing environment
job_title: Performance Improvement Coordinator in Portland, OR
pros:
- Great people
- Mission centered
- Large system with multitude of career opportunities
- Commitment to investing in staff
cons: - Rapidly changing due to policy reform and shifting market - some change fatigue among staff

review_title: An Okay place to build your career.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Portland, OR
pros: Most staff is easy to get along with, patient care focused and helpful with career goals.
cons: Poor management organization, benefits are outrageously expensive and pays for little when there is a healthcare event in your life. St. Vincent hospital is a miserable place to work for. CNAs are discouraged to unionized.

pros: Clinical ladder pay raise program, certification pay, good vacation allowances, tuition reimbursement, they pay for continuing education, many units do self scheduling or pattern schedules, EMR, simple on line scheduling system, lots of unit level control....
cons: Some decisions made regionally get little staff nurse input, so much unit based counsel power that some units are extremely different all in one organization, inion doesn't allow for internal higher inflation based on fit and qualifications but based on primarily seniority

review_title: Best decision I’ve made in my career!
pros: Team environment. Truly practices and believes in their mission and core values. Everyone wants you to succeed!
cons: Didn’t have a formal leadership on boarding, however they are getting ready to roll out their newly developed program so it won’t be an issue. Even when there was t one formally, my boss made sure to connect me with various people to get what I needed.

pros: Providence has great healthcare benefits and the wage is very comparable to other facilities in the area.
cons: Management does not help when things get very busy. The DNS and administrator don't understand that the reason nurses stay over after their shift is over is because the nurse managers don't help and they give you more work to do.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst in Renton, WA
pros:
People were nice
Public transportation provided
cons:
Unorganized and inefficient processes
Jobs being outsourced leaving uneasy feelings among many employees

pros: Good place to work. Staffed well, a big plus. Minimum contract staff. Pay equal to other catholic hospitals. Good orientation, and continuing ed, not rushed.
cons: Pay not as much as University hospitals. Float or pulled to other floors when census is low. Pulled to units not always compatible with where your working.

job_title: Human Resources Leader in Renton, WA
pros: An organization that truly values people and wants to make a positive difference in the world.
cons: People work so hard - sometimes too hard - and might burn out.

review_title: Great people but western medicine hospitals are going down hill
pros: For the most part I'd say Providence is staffed with wonderfully loving and helpful folks who really believe that what they're doing makes a difference in lives.
cons: Overrun by politics and governmental bureaucracy...as most hospitals probably are these days.

pros: Just Culture; non punitive environment with focus on true advancement of practice and development of sound quality improvement measures.
cons: Poor fiscal management with layoffs in consecutive years. Areas of focus to manage costs and improve income/reimbursement are lacking in scope.

job_title: Physical Therapist in Mission Hills, CA
pros: Faith Based hospital with a strong Mission and Core Values that they strive to emulate and uphold in all they do.Tolerant of all faiths and celebrate diversity.Good employee support and training.Strong teamwork and interdisciplinary support.
cons: As the company grows, and processes start to regionalize, there is more red tape/ bureaucracy at times.

pros: The Hospital itself is a good place to work. Staff is really nice and seems the hospital is wanting to expand and going to the right direction.
cons: Schedules are always changing and never set. Supervisors are not very helpful at times and do not solve issues in a timely manor

review_title: The mission and core values of Providence make it a great place to work.
job_title: Privacy Monitoring Analyst II in Renton, WA
pros: The fact Providence is a not-for-profit organization allows for a more patient-centered culture. They strongly focus on charity care for those in the community.
cons: There is high turnover and lay-offs that occur due to fast growth and innovation. They tend to move too fast and implement change before solidly planning.

job_title: IS Strategic Partner in Portland, OR
pros: Amazing company with a culture like no other. Great people, great work, great pay.
cons: There are no cons to my job.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Seattle, WA
pros: Attempt at an innovative culture
cons: Management egos creating a toxic culture

review_title: Overworked, and yet its still never enough
job_title: Member Service Representative in Beaverton, OR
pros: a few co-coworkers make it fun. 8-5, Mon- Fri, sometimes flexibility on your schedule
cons:
where to start, management has favorites, youre overworked and yet youre still not doing enough, management treats you like they are doing you a favor, and you should be chained to your desk. Just stay away
Callers act like its life and death matters,

review_title: It's been a very chaotic experience with ups and downs and at times it's wonderful and at other times it's miserable.
pros: I'm glad I have a job during this economy and Providence does take care of it's employees when they can.
cons: Management does not have a clue what they are doing and most of us are overworked with too many responsibilities.

review_title: Driven by mission, vision and values
pros: The commitment to live by the values is real. That doesn't mean everybody is perfect, but the culture promotes a genuine attempt to exemplify the mission, vision and values. People are generally friendly and helpful. I feel valued here.
cons: I've not experienced any major cons.

pros:
Great co-workers. Most were really sharp and eager to assist.
I really believe in the overall mission of the health system. Interaction with the Sister's and understanding what they had accomplished was great.
Overall compensation was good. Lots of training opportunities and good retirement benefits.
cons: Management has no clue what they are doing. Direction changes and failed implementations are par for the course. The new CIO is clueless on how to run an organization.

job_title: Director Supply Chain in Renton, WA
pros: Company truly lives its Mission and Core Values. Great work life balance.  Becoming an innovator in the health Care space.
cons: Mission and Core values are often used as an excuse for not innovating, adapting, implementing faster.  Salary skews low for the market.

review_title: I love what I do, just not where i do it.
pros: Good benefits, lots of experience, discounts at many locations due to employment here, high level of professionalism and good ideas to improve employee satisfaction
cons: Management is less than stellar, employees feel that providence finds patient care is less important than money. Sadly the good ideas they want employees to implement are not taken seriously by management.

pros: Great people.  Employees are treated with dignity and respect.  Good work life balance.  Culture is not as reactive as other companies
cons: They have not embraced telecommuting or flexible schedules.  Annual bonus for levels below director is pretty much non existent.  Not too many company or team building events so it's difficult to network within the company

pros: Great pay and benefits. Very busy throughout all shifts, 10 hour shifts with 30 min break. It's of opportunity to move up.
cons: There seems to be a disconnect between employees and management. There is an uneven expectation of work amongst different employees in the same department that causes tension. If you go in to work and give 110% and avoid the drama, you'll like working there.

job_title: Medical Office Specialist in Portland, OR
pros:
Career opportunities

Retirement benefits

Health insurance covers 80%

Rewards program that discounts fun activities

Credit Union
cons:
Coworkers backstabbing and sabotaging each other to compete for bosses Pet position.

Corrupt supervisory practices on employees to make them fail and have grounds to fire the staff and replace with friends.

Discrimination of sick employees on FMLA

Employees who are healthy with no chronic illness have a better chance to make a career at Providence.

pros: Best job I ever had.  As a night shift nurse, the assistant nurse managers were awesome and the coworkers were amazing.  My colleagues were very accepting and had great attitudes, making it fun to work with.  I never had issues with my schedule.  I never had issues with my superiors.  There was also plenty of opportunity to learn new skills and take on patients of higher acuity.
cons: I didn't have any issues

pros:
Great mission working to improve healthcare of underserved communities.
Some really sharp and caring co-workers.
cons: Toxic work environment. See employee and employer comments to decide for yourself if it seems like a place you want to spend your time: search for "Reddit Aaron Martin ama" (Glassdoor won't let us post links).

pros: Providence has been a very supportive place to work with good work life balance and a sense of caring for the community. The hiring managers are on the whole good folks.
cons: They outsourced the entire recruiting function. The bureaucracy can be tiresome.

review_title: I still believe, even if they don’t
pros: The mission is a beautiful thing. We used to live by it. It’s gone out the window and it is all about profit now.
cons: Cutting positions, making demands that can’t be met. We’re working so short now, I’m afraid patients will get hurt.

review_title: An organization that continues to go nationally
pros: Helpful co-workers. History of caring for the less fortunate. Gives back to the community. Invests in the lastest technologies.
cons: Sometimes growth can cause growing pains. Almost all shifts are 12 hours in length.

pros: Beautiful Place to Live .
cons: HR dept consistently undermines directors and managers. They create  an impossible situation to effectively achieve goals. Lots of complaints but never any answers or plans for corrective action(s) .

review_title: Changing culture, with a mission that is still credible
pros: The mission is widespread and practiced.  The system as a whole provides great quality, personalized, sincere care. The individual departments or ministries do not coordinate well.
cons: Some departments foster a poor work environment with managers that may be talented in the work, but not the art of managing people (blaming, finger pointing).

review_title: First time giving any employer a bad rating.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Nice people, strong mission messaging, Pretty buildings.
cons: Invisible leadership, reactionary problem solving, stewardship on the backs of its caregivers, too many long term employees with no new ideas, echo chamber constantly congratulating themselves.  HR practices borders malpractice. Employee survey gets looked at once a year. Overly emotional empathy does not equal best practice.

pros: Good benefits. Compensation was okay.
cons: My department orientation was very chaotic and lacking. Was given incorrect information that was not correct until many months later. For a month I had no safe designated work space. I was consistently left off meeting invites, then questioned by my boss why I didn't attend. I think this was more due to my disorganized department than to Providence as a whole.

review_title: Good place to work, but many internal problems
pros:
Friendly and supportive co-workers
mission statement holds true to the job
cons:
Clear communication is NOT a strong practice, especially among certain managers
Lack of support to certain disciplines
Management is not held to basic standards that all other employees are held to (absences, breaks, etc)
It is difficult to find other positions within Providence (site is difficult to navigate)
Not enough opportunity for career advancement

review_title: Our Organization is Committed to Quality Care in an Unrelenting Harsh Society
job_title: Psychiatric Social Worker in Olympia, WA
pros: Agency faithful to it's Core Values. Many, many incredible committed co-workers. Truly supportive management.
cons: Day in and out dealing with the unceasing onslaught of life suffering: cruel addictions, unrelenting mental illness, disease, injuries, with insufficient ongoing resources is so draining.

review_title: Current offsite Contract Interim Director is a bully
pros: Supportive co-workers though others sabotage work
cons: Offsite management have no idea about day to day activities and local issues, office culture is highly toxic and supported by HR

review_title: Not a place that encourages career growth
pros: Some of my co-workers
cons: I worked in a department within HR/Finance which is just a glorified call center and getting worse. If that is the environment you want to work in great but I was looking to put my many years of experience into play and that won't happen. Also, don't expect more than a 20 cent raise every year. And for a health care company the benefits aren't very good at all. I'm not talking about the cost (which isn't any better than other large companies) so much as the choices.

Competitive compensation and benefits. 
So many growth opportunities.
My position has a flex schedule, which was nice.
cons: Because it's so big, implementation of anything new or making requests is a very slow process.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: You do make great friends with your coworkers and they give away free turkeys to all employees at Thanksgiving.
cons: The organization has many faults as to how they run the hospital starting from the hiring process to orientation and finally leaving. Departments do not seem to know what other departments are doing and you're never really sure about the hierarchy of the hospital - specifically within Behavioral Health.

pros: Good work environment and management. Room for development and carer advancement. Competitive salary and flexible scheduling
